Package us.daveread.edu.graphics.tool

Class Pen.MyPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.geom.Point2D
      • java.awt.Point
        • us.daveread.edu.graphics.tool.Pen.MyPoint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Enclosing class:
    Pen
    private class Pen.MyPoint
extends java.awt.Point
    A point that stores the coordinates as doubles. This class is used so that the destination point calculations which involve fractional values do not accumulate rounding error. Instead the fractional vales will be retained through each calculation. This allows shapes such as circles to be drawn by adjusting the direction by 1-degree increments and drawing 1 pixel line segments.

    Note that the java.awt.Point class appears to support storing coordinates as doubles. However the getX() and getY() methods are simply returning the underlying integer X and Y values as doubles.

    Author:
    readda
